comments.html:
"Quick link for the attention-challenged"

I'll have you know, sir, that the politically-correct term for this disability is "differently attentive." In the future, please show more compassion for those of us who--ooh look, a kitty!
comments.name: stretch

comments.html:
ROFL :-D Thank you, you've made my day 8-)

OTOH, you can't imagine how hard it is to properly address these difficult areas when English is not your native language O:-)
comments.name: Ivan Pepelnjak

comments.html: Ivan, this is an old post, but, do you have any examples or just thoughts on MPLS Inter-AS Option C. Does it really saves all the operational work? Is it really used in practice?
comments.name: JCC

comments.html: Inter-AS Option C is used in practice and is definitely a better option than (A). Whether you prefer (B) or (C) depends on what you want to ASBR routers to do and how much you trust the other AS.
comments.name: Ivan Pepelnjak
